speaker: narrator
line: Maelle asks Verso if they could talk by the lake. They walk there together.

speaker: Maelle
line: I found the letter.

speaker: Verso
line: What?

speaker: Maelle
line: From Alicia.

speaker: Maelle
line: I need to see her. I want to talk to her. And understand…

speaker: Verso
line: Understand what?

speaker: Maelle
line: Why Maman…

speaker: Verso
line: What, kept her scars? No. Don’t go messing with her head, she doesn’t need that, and she doesn’t owe you any answers.

speaker: Maelle
line: She’s the one who kept coming to me. I think she wants to see me.

speaker: Verso
line: Just leave her be. Please.

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso. You’re not doing her any favours. You already destroyed her world. Maybe I can help her. She doesn’t owe me, but… maybe I owe her.

speaker: Maelle
line: And let’s not talk about what YOU owe her. Don’t you wanna see her too?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, of course. She doesn’t want to see me though. Not after everything.

speaker: Maelle
line: Then she can throw us out and we’ll leave her alone.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is that a yes?

speaker: Maelle
line: Great, where is she?

speaker: Verso
line: If I had to guess… There is a place she loves, at the top of the mountain near the Monolith. With the third Axon.

speaker: Maelle
line: Oh. That Axon… I guess we’re climbing.

speaker: narrator
line: Verso promised to take Maelle to his sister. She is most likely in a giant on the island of the last Axon, near the Monolith.

speaker: Lune
line: Another Axon. How did it get so large?

speaker: Verso
line: She wasn’t always this tall. But she’s obsessed with reaching the stars, so…

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa and his parables.

speaker: Verso
line: Parables?

speaker: Maelle
line: He never paints just to paint. Everything has to have layers and layers of meaning and purpose. Everything’s a lesson.

speaker: Verso
line: Hmm.

speaker: Lune
line: What’s the lesson with this one?

speaker: Maelle
line: Hope.

speaker: Verso
line: Alici- My sister’s at the top.

speaker: Maelle
line: And Papa knows I have vertigo.

speaker: Sciel
line: Are they trying to fix things? Or break things?

speaker: Monoco
line: She Who Grasps The Sky. They’re jealous. They wish to destroy her work. Pull her back to the ground.

speaker: Lune
line: Is this part of “the parable?”

speaker: Maelle
line: Everything is.

speaker: Sciel
line: Did that Nevron just kick a different Nevron off the tower?

speaker: Verso
line: Looks that way.

speaker: Maelle
line: (amused exasperation)

speaker: Maelle
line: Vertigo, remember? His intentions are good, I know… but his methods…

speaker: Lune
line: Your father?

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m the youngest, which makes everything worse.

speaker: Lune
line: Oh, I understand that.

speaker: Sciel
line: Only child.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah. Clea’s the oldest. She’s just so… perfect. So… accomplished and talented. Papa’s favourite, he’s so proud of her. And Verso… Verso could always make Papa laugh. They had so many inside jokes. Then there’s me…

speaker: Verso
line: And then there’s you. The ACTUAL favourite. The one he calls his “hidden star,” but who’s too shy and self-conscious to see it.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yet here I am, messing things up even more.

speaker: Verso
line: Look around. He just wants you to fly.

speaker: narrator
line: This Orphelin is different from the rest. It does not sabotage. It builds.

speaker: Lune
line: All these inventions—Gustave would have loved to see this.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hello.

speaker: Verso
line: Alicia. Your letter…

speaker: Maelle
line: She blames us, doesn’t she? You didn’t deserve that… Oh. You’re the real Axon. You know Papa painted her? So you know who she represents. You… like? Being here? With her? I guess… this… represents his hope. For us. For me, then. Go. Claim your piece of sky. We both deserve to fly. Let me give you a new beginning.

speaker: Verso
line: Alicia—

speaker: Alicia
line: Send me to my family.

speaker: Verso
line: Wait—Maelle—!

speaker: narrator
line: At camp, Verso refuses to talk to anyone. He stands alone by the lake. After a while, Maelle decides to go and talk to him.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m sorry.

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s what she wanted. I owed her that much. We owed her that much.

speaker: Maelle
line: I honoured her wishes. That’s something neither you nor Renoir ever did. And not Maman either.

speaker: Verso
line: … I didn’t get to say goodbye. You didn’t wait. You didn’t give me a chance to persuade her.

speaker: Maelle
line: She knew what she wanted. You wouldn’t have been able to sway her.

speaker: Verso
line: She’s not you. You don’t know that. I know her better than you do. But you didn’t even give me the chance to try. You just erased her.

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso…

speaker: Verso
line: You’ve lost two brothers. You know what it’s like to lose your sibling and never get the chance to say goodbye.

speaker: Verso
line: You Painters. You just do what you want, you don’t care how it affects the rest of us.

speaker: Maelle
line: I do care. I know you’re hurting, but the person who made that decision wasn’t me. It was her. It would have been wrong to deny her just so you could try and talk her out of her decision.

speaker: Verso
line: She’s the last of my family. I have no one left now.

speaker: Maelle
line: You have me. You have us.

speaker: Verso
line: Maelle. I wasn’t ready.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t understand. You were ready when you set Papa free. You expected that he would erase the Canvas and everyone in it. Isn’t that the same thing?

speaker: Verso
line: It’s different. It’s different. Why did she do that?

speaker: Maelle
line: You know why.

speaker: Maelle
line: But you’re right. I should have thought of you. I should have given you a chance to say goodbye. I’m truly sorry, Verso.

speaker: Verso
line: … At least she’s free now.

speaker: narrator
line: Despite his frustration, Verso understands Maelle’s words. He appreciates that Maelle is honest with him and Maelle empathises deeply with Verso. Maelle and Verso feel closer to each other. They sit in silence a little longer. This time, Maelle comforts Verso. They head back to the others.
